intro: Pelargonium pectinifolium, commonly known as the woolly geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its distinctive fuzzy, velvety leaves that give it a soft, woolly appearance. The plant produces small, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in spring and summer. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and compact growth habit. Pelargonium pectinifolium prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for rock gardens and containers.
